Shopping to Meet the Needs of the Poor.--I go to Sydney today to the yearly sales to purchase some goods. They have these sales to rid the stores of their old stock. The poor 
                                                                           331
around us are suffering for food and clothing, and I can buy at an advantage by visiting these stores. We economize as much as possible, and there is need enough for it.... There are many poor who are distressed for want of food and clothing who are of the household of faith. Our purses will scarcely suffice to reach the needs of those we know. Jesus says, "Inasmuch as ye have done it unto one of the least of these My brethren, ye have done it unto Me." How precious are these words of comfort to the poor!--Letter 39, 1895.
